website_summaries.verdict: Surprisingly inexpensive die grinder from a highly regarded air tool manufacturer. Gives very good performance for the money.
pros: Ideal for light- and medium-duty tasks
Easy to control with high rotational speed for fast, efficient work on a variety of materials
Compact body makes it great for small spaces
you can use it just about anywhere your hand will go

customer_reviews.title: Works but chuck won't let go of the bit
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was going to be a good die grinder but any time I want to change out a tool (wire wheel or flap disc or carbide grinding bi) the chuck fights me the whole way. It's not very fun dreading having to change out the bit. Yes I loosen the tightening nut when trying to change out the bit.
customer_reviews.author: chapparito

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: It did not state that it did not come with the wrenches to be able to use it. Disappointed that now I will have to wait even longer to get the work done with it. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Thornton

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cleanup of  rust on hard parts.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for quite a few cleanup uses with various 2 inch sanding and cleanup pads. Lots of power! Good feel in hand. I love this tool. I do oil it. Only owned about a month, and has maybe 4 days use on it. I recommend based on performance. Time will tell on longevity.
customer_reviews.author: RYAN MACEWEN PRUYN

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool, reasonable price. No trigger safety though.
customer_reviews.text: Decent tool, well made, ergonomic design. Reasonably priced, imo. Only complaint: No trigger lock-out, which is a nice safety feature.
customer_reviews.author: G. D. Golden

customer_reviews.title: Tough tool.
customer_reviews.text: Very good tool, I even bought a second one. Lots of use. Used 8 hours straight. No problems, just make sure you oil them often.
customer_reviews.author: NG

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: The head keeps coming loose spinning the head around. I don't know if that's a common problem but I know I hate it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Alex Cerney

customer_reviews.title: value
customer_reviews.text: you can't beat it for the price. I use it daily and its held up to some abuse in a shop setting
customer_reviews.author: frankfurt

customer_reviews.title: Good customer service and good product
customer_reviews.text: Originally had problems with it but campbell has good customer service and replaced it. Speed control is nice and easy, works great!
customer_reviews.author: E. Turner

customer_reviews.title: Good size with good power
customer_reviews.text: Great size, with enough power to get the job done. We'll be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: Baumach

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Ease of use. Hand held comfort. Does the job well
customer_reviews.author: CHELSY CHELS

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very good product, and shipping was fast. I do wish more accessories came, but good a product.
customer_reviews.author: Cory McCall

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Good control,collet does not tighten down securely to hold some tools.
customer_reviews.author: James C.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I use from time to time, great product and great price
customer_reviews.author: Ricky

customer_reviews.title: Nice little die grinder!
customer_reviews.text: Speed control is smooth, and overall feel is great. Happy with this for less than 35bucks!
customer_reviews.author: B. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment with my Cambell grinder
customer_reviews.text: It came apart in the first 2 minutes of use. I'm a proffetional grinder and all arround finisher. So I know my tools. Put back together. But should not have too.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Light but easy to control for speed and angle
customer_reviews.text: worked very well. Light but easy to control for speed and angle. Used it to grind off the head of a stripped bolt and worked great. very good buy
customer_reviews.author: C. J. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Comes apart
customer_reviews.text: It is constantly coming apart. Pain it the butt and hard to get anything done when you are repairing it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Pace

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: After maybe 5 times using about 10 minutes each time head keeps coming apart .Would not buy again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Top Quality in Tight spaces
customer_reviews.text: High quality! Gets the job done for fine detail work in tight spaces
customer_reviews.author: Dublot

customer_reviews.title: Works great and is really nice for getting in the small ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great and is really nice for getting in the small places also.Alot of them are just to large on the ends and this is easy to hold also. Price is right also.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, slacking workmanship!
customer_reviews.text: The tool works great! Only downfall is the plastic housing. The threads strip out over a while. I suggest using a swivel fitting the help.
customer_reviews.author: Flash

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Within 20 minutes of starting to use the grinder the collet loosened and made the tool inoperable I repaired the problem once and 20 minutes later it was inoperable again. After having it for one hour I packaged it up and promptly returned it. I hope the one i received but I got a Chicago Pneumatic that works fine. I would not recommend this grinder in any way, shape, or form! It DIDN"T (Get Stuff Done) at all.
customer_reviews.author: Gary W Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I actually love the trigger and the fact that there is no pain in the ass lock built-in to it that I have to take out again, been using these type of grinders every day for 35+ years about time they finally made them without the stupid flip lock.
customer_reviews.author: D. Robinson

product_meta.title: Campbell Hausfeld 1/4" Die Grinder (TL052001AV)
product_meta.description:
Size:Straight Die GrinderThe Campbell Hausfeld air die grinder (TL052001AV) operates at a fast 25,000 rpm, making it perfect for quickly smoothing sharp edges, deburring, polishing, porting and grinding a wide variety of materials including metal, plastic and wood. This air die grinder requires 6.2 SCFM of air @ 90 PSI. Finish your projects faster and easier with Campbell Hausfeld - The Air Power Expert.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Finish your automotive and woodworking projects faster and easier with the benefits of air power. Air tools provide more power than electric tools. Air tools are lighter and more compact compared to their electric counterpart. They are easier to maintain and operate with fewer moving parts. Air tools also operate at cooler temperatures. 25,000 rpms provides the speed for grinding, porting, smoothing, general polishing and deburring. Ideal for use on a variety of materials including wood, plastic, metal, ceramic and cast iron.
feature_bullets: Operates at a fast 25,000 rpm, for smooth, clean grinding results across many materials
The TL052001AV requires 6.2 SCFM of air @ 90 PSI
Ideal for smoothing sharp edges, deburring, polishing, porting and grinding a wide variety of materials including metal, plastic and wood
Finish your projects faster and easier with Campbell Hausfeld - The Air Power Expert

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars54 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
